condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.2: Key national institutions have capacity in M&E and research and generate quality evidence on vulnerabilities and disparities

description.narrative: Government's counterparts, such as Department of Statistics and Ministry of Water and Infrastructure, improved their evidence-based decision making capacity through UNICEF Jordan's support, including capacity building and evidence generation to inform about the programmes and situation in Jordan, including Syrian refugee children and women. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: Percentage of planned studies, surveys and evaluations completed and disseminated

target.value: 2015:Target 1: 100% initiated, Target 2: 100% of completed studies surveys and evaluations disseminated

title.narrative: Availability of plan for strengthening M&E capacities (Y/N)

actual.value: 2017:M&E Capacity Development Plan and Guidelines exist. Based on these, continuous on- the-job-trainings were provided to staff members and implementing partners on developing a results framework through Programme Cooperation Agreements review process. title.narrative: Number of Governmental entities that provide data with necessary disaggregation on the situation of children and young people, in line with Jordan

baseline.value: Selected governmental entities with no existent M&E system

target.value: 2017:4 governmental entities (Juvenile Police, MoSD, MoE, DOS) provide data with necessary disaggregation

actual.value: 2017:UNICEF Jordan supported Ministry of Planning and International Cooperation to strengthen the monitoring system for implementation of Jordan Response Plan.
